com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.socket.advanced

Class SocketAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.socket.advanced.SocketAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IsTechnologyAdapter, IComponent, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable, IManagedThreadCallbacks

    public class SocketAdapter
extends ComponentHelper
implements IManagedThreadCallbacks, IsTechnologyAdapter
    Each client that connects to the SocketAdapterServer gets its own SocketAdapter. The SocketAdapter handles the underlying send and receive mechanism of the protocol.

    Notes on how the Advanced Socket Adapter objects fit together:

    • For each Session (using socket adapter) there is a SocketAdapterSourceListener.
    • For all of these that share a port, there is a single SocketAdapterServer.
    • For each SocketAdapterServer there is a list of SocketAdapters, one for each socket client connection (e.g., internal OMS apps).
    • For each SocketAdapter, there is a list of SocketQueueReaders, one for each Session.
    • For each Session (using socket adapter), there is a queue that is shared between the SessionQueueReader and the SocketAdapterSourceListener.
    1. How RESET works
    SocketAdapterServer calls SocketAdapter.reset() for each of the socketAdapterList[]. SocketAdapter calls SocketQueueReader.reset() for each of the reader[] elements.

    2. Incoming FIX traffic
    Messages from FIX come to SocketAdapterSourceListener.onMessageFromFix() and are appended to the queue. Each SessionQueueReader is waiting for the next message arrive and will pick up the new message and call SocketAdapter.sendProtocolMsg(msg).

    This has been modified to distribute(msg) directly in the case where a lower sequence message is received so that possible duplicates are not lost after a higher sequence number 'logon' message has been received.

    3. Outbound FIX traffic
    SocketAdapter receives a ProtocolMsg from the user's socket client application and forwards the message to the session by calling the SocketAdapterServer's fireMessage(), which distributes the message to the appropriate connection point with the help of SharedFixSource.

      • connectAdapter

        protected void connectAdapter(SocketMessage msg)
                       throws Exception
        Called when a new SocketClient connects. The SocketMessage of the SocketClient is passed in and the Session details are recovered. The SocketAdapter then replies with a CONNECT_ACK message which contains the Ack Id of the last outbound message processed from the client.
        Parameters:
        msg - SocketMessage of the SocketClient
        Throws:
        Exception - TBD

      • getMessagesFrom

        public void getMessagesFrom(SocketMessage msg)
        Reset sequence number to that specified in the given table. We need to reset waiting for acknowledgments for any previous messages because we are going to start from another sequence number.
        Parameters:
        msg - should contain a table set, just like the CONNECT message.
